text: Southborough Pit is a geological Site of Special Scientific Interest in Tunbridge Wells in Kent. It is a Geological Conservation Review site. This site dates to the Valanginian age, around 140 million years ago in the Lower Cretaceous. It is the type locality for the High Brooms Soil Bed, which contains the aquatic horsetail Equisetes lyellii. Footpaths go through the site, but it has been filled in and no geology is visible. ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Kent Category:Geological Conservation Review sites
title: Southborough Pit
